questionsData.title: We can measure acidity with naked eyes.
Water evaporates into vapor.
Prism is an example of reflection.
Sound is the effect of something vibrates.
Diseases are cured before they are treated.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Diseases are treated before they are cured .

The terms "cure" and "treat" are related to medical or therapeutic interventions, but they have distinct meanings:

Treat: This is the first step, where scientists and doctors recognize a new illness or condition.

Example:

  • Treating a bacterial infection with antibiotics.

Cure: A cure completely eliminates the disease from the body.

Example :

  • Smallpox eradicated by widespread vaccination.

"Yours faithfully" and "sincerely" are phrases used for closing a letter.
Somebody who gives advice is a school leaver.
Figs are kind of vegetables.
Fish curry is a kind of delicious dish.
People who work on ship are called crew.
Pirates are group of people who help sailors.
The text is mainly talking about………
questionsData.article: As technology becomes more and more advanced, athletes will soon have contact lenses that do more than correct vision problems. High-tech (high technology) lenses can greatly improve eyesight so that an athlete’s eyesight is much stronger than the average person’s. This gives an (unfair 2) advantage to some athletes. In my opinion, sports organization ought to have rules against contact lenses in competitions. Eyesight is extremely important in sports like golf and basketball. Athletes have to see objects that are very far away. For this reason, if they have super-vision because of high-tech contact lenses, they will play better than other athletes. Professional golfers that use high-tech contact lenses have greatly improved their performance.The cost is another reason I am (against 1) high-tech contact lenses. These lenses are too expensive for many players. Players who cannot afford (them 3) are at a disadvantage. For these reasons, I feel strongly that there must be rules against high-tech lenses in some sports.

questionsData.title: There isn't …… water in the mountains.
…….. is a compound word.
Garlic is a vegetable .The word "vegetable" is a/ an …..
The word "uncountable" has ….
Swimming is……..interesting than climbing.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Swimming is more interesting than climbing.

  • Many and much don't function as comparatives. They indicate quantity, not a comparison between two things.
  • Most can be used in comparatives, but it suggests the strongest level of something. In this case, we want to say swimming is interesting to a greater degree than climbing, not the absolute most interesting.
  • More is the correct comparative form of interesting. It indicates that swimming is interesting to a higher level compared to climbing.

questionsData.title: Yemen is as …..as Syria.
Hens are covered ………feathers.
The man ……. I helped, is my teacher.
………… the intense cold , sheep have coats of heavy wool.
Samia has a ……. temper.
questionsData.explain_answer:
Samia has a good temper.

  • Good is the opposite of bad and indicates a positive quality. When referring to temper, a good temper means someone is calm, patient, and doesn't get easily angered.
  • Well doesn't directly describe temper.
  • Best is typically used for superlative qualities, and here we want to describe a characteristic, not the absolute best.
  • Worst (used twice) is clearly not what we're looking for, as it emphasizes a very negative temper.

questionsData.title: Last week, Anisa ……. some cakes to school.
I'm tired, I think I ….. to bed early.
Sameer is ……of giving up his job.
If I …… you, I would study information technology.
The news …. carefully by the new presenter last night.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The news was read carefully by the new presenter last night.

  • The sentence describes an action that happened in the past (last night).
  • "The news" is the singular subject, so we need the past tense singular form of the verb.
  • Was read is the past participle of "read" used with the helping verb "was" to form the passive voice.

Review: News Is Singular And Uncountable

  • Say “some news” or “a piece of news” (not “a news”)
  • Say “the news is/was” (not “the news are/were”)
  • Say “this/that news” (not “these/those news”)
  • Say “a lot of / lots of news” (not “many news”)

questionsData.title: The new supermarket ……… built lately.
questionsData.explain_answer:
The new supermarket has been built lately.

"has been" is the correct choice because it indicates that the action of building the new supermarket started in the past and has recently been completed. "Has been" is the present perfect tense, which is commonly used to describe actions that have occurred at an unspecified time before now, with relevance to the present moment.
